title: Facing Conservative Opposition, House Republicans Nix Border Bill Vote
teaser: House GOP leaders have abruptly canceled a vote on their own bill meant to address the surge of unaccompanied minors at the Mexican border.  An effort to pass a pared down version of President Obama's request was blocked by a group of Tea Party conservatives.  NPR's Senior Correspondent Ron Elving discusses the state of play.
